Maturity Modelling

maturity_HTP.Rd

Maturity Modelling

Usage

maturity_HTP(
  results,
  canopy,
  index = "GLI",
  check_negative = TRUE,
  add_zero = TRUE,
  plot_id = NULL,
  method = c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms"),
  return_method = FALSE,
  parameters = c(t1 = 38.7, t2 = 62, t3 = 90, k = 0.32, beta = -0.01),
  lower = -Inf,
  upper = Inf,
  initial_vals = FALSE,
  fn = sse_lin_pl_lin
)

Arguments

results

Object of class exploreHTP

canopy

Object of class canopy_HTP

index

A string specifying the trait to be modeled. Default is "GLI".

check_negative

TRUE of FALSE. Convert negative values to zero.

add_zero

TRUE or FALSE. Add zero to the time series.TRUE by default.

plot_id

Optional Plot ID. NULL by default

method

A vector of the methods to be used, each as a character string. See optimx package. c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms") by default.

return_method

TRUE or FALSE. To return the method selected for the optimization in the table. FALSE by default.

parameters

(Optional) Initial values for the parameters to be optimized over. c(t1 = 38.7, t2 = 62, t3 = 90, k = 0.32, beta = -0.01) by default.

lower

Bounds on the variables for methods such as "L-BFGS-B" that can handle box (or bounds) constraints.

upper

Bounds on the variables for methods such as "L-BFGS-B" that can handle box (or bounds) constraints.

initial_vals

TRUE or FALSE. If the user wants to use t1 and t2 from the Canopy model as initial values. Only works if the function fn uses t1 and t2 as parameters. FALSE by default.

fn

A function to be minimized (or maximized), with first argument the vector of parameters over which minimization is to take place. It should return a scalar result. Default is sse_lin_pl_lin.

Value

A list with two elements:

param

A data frame containing the optimized parameters and related information.

dt

A data frame with data used.

Examples

library(exploreHTP)
data(dt_potato)
dt_potato <- dt_potato
results <- read_HTP(
  data = dt_potato,
  genotype = "Gen",
  time = "DAP",
  plot = "Plot",
  traits = c("Canopy", "GLI_2"),
  row = "Row",
  range = "Range"
)
names(results)
#> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long"         
out <- canopy_HTP(
  results = results,
  canopy = "Canopy",
  plot_id = c(195, 40),
  correct_max = TRUE,
  add_zero = TRUE
)
mat <- maturity_HTP(
  results = results,
  canopy = out,
  index = "GLI_2",
  parameters = c(t1 = 38.7, t2 = 62, t3 = 90, k = 0.32, beta = -0.01),
  fn = sse_lin_pl_lin
)
plot(mat, plot_id = c(195, 40))
